verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: The word that came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Thus speaketh the LORD God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
verses.web: “LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Write all the words that I have spoken to you in a book.
verses.ct: "The LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'Write down everything I have spoken to you in a book.

verses.kjv: For, lo, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the LORD: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
verses.web: For, behold, the days come,’ says LORD, ‘that I will reverse the captivity of my people Israel and Judah,’ says LORD. ‘I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.’ ”
verses.ct: The days are coming,' declares the LORD, 'when I will bring my people Israel and Judah back from captivity. I will return them to the land I gave their ancestors, and they will take possession of it again.'"

verses.kjv: And these are the words that the LORD spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
verses.web: These are the words that LORD spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
verses.ct: These are the words the LORD spoke about Israel and Judah.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
verses.web: For LORD says: “We have heard a voice of trembling; a voice of fear, and not of peace.
verses.ct: The LORD says: "We have heard cries of terror — voices filled with fear, not peace.

verses.kjv: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
verses.web: Ask now, and see whether a man travails with child. Why do I see every man with his hands on his waist, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned pale?
verses.ct: Think about it — can a man go through labor pains? Then why do I see every man doubled over, clutching his stomach like a woman giving birth? Why has every face gone pale?

verses.kjv: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble, but he shall be saved out of it.
verses.web: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it. It is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he will be saved out of it.
verses.ct: What a terrible day that will be! There has never been anything like it. It is the time of Jacob's trouble — but he will be rescued from it.

verses.kjv: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the LORD of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
verses.web: It will come to pass in that day, says LORD of Armies, that I will break his yoke from off your neck, and will burst your bonds. Strangers will no more make them their bondservants;
verses.ct: On that day," declares the LORD of hosts, "I will snap the yoke off your neck and tear your chains apart. Foreign nations will never enslave my people again.

verses.kjv: But they shall serve the LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
verses.web: but they will serve LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up to them.
verses.ct: Instead, they will serve the LORD their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.

verses.kjv: Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the LORD; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
verses.web: Therefore don’t be afraid, O Jacob my servant, says LORD. Don’t be dismayed, Israel. For, behold, I will save you from afar, and save your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return, and will be quiet and at ease. No one will make him afraid.
verses.ct: So don't be afraid, Jacob my servant," declares the LORD. "Don't lose heart, Israel. I will rescue you from distant lands and bring your descendants home from the countries where they are held captive. Jacob will return and live in peace and safety, and no one will threaten him again.

verses.kjv: For I am with thee, saith the LORD, to save thee: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee, yet will I not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
verses.web: For I am with you, says LORD, to save you; for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have scattered you, but I will not make a full end of you; but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.”
verses.ct: I am with you to save you," declares the LORD. "I will completely destroy every nation where I scattered you, but I will not completely destroy you. I will discipline you fairly — but I will not let you go unpunished."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Thy bruise is incurable, and thy wound is grievous.
verses.web: For LORD says, “Your hurt is incurable. Your wound is grievous.
verses.ct: The LORD says: "Your wound is beyond healing. Your injury is severe.

verses.kjv: There is none to plead thy cause, that thou mayest be bound up: thou hast no healing medicines.
verses.web: There is no one to plead your cause, that you may be bound up. You have no healing medicines.
verses.ct: No one steps forward to defend your case. There is no bandage for your wound, no medicine that can heal you.

verses.kjv: All thy lovers have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for I have wounded thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the multitude of thine iniquity; because thy sins were increased.
verses.web: All your lovers have forgotten you. They don’t seek you. For I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins were increased.
verses.ct: All your allies have forgotten you — they don't even look for you anymore. I struck you the way an enemy would, with the harsh punishment of a cruel attacker, because your guilt was so enormous and your sins so many.

verses.kjv: Why criest thou for thine affliction? thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity: because thy sins were increased, I have done these things unto thee.
verses.web: Why do you cry over your injury? Your pain is incurable. For the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins have increased, I have done these things to you.
verses.ct: Why do you cry out over your suffering? Your pain cannot be cured. Because your guilt was so enormous and your sins so many, I did this to you.

verses.kjv: Therefore all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all thine adversaries, every one of them, shall go into captivity; and they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee will I give for a prey.
verses.web: Therefore all those who devour you will be devoured. All your adversaries, everyone of them, will go into captivity. Those who plunder you will be plunder. I will make all who prey on you become prey.
verses.ct: But here is the turning point: everyone who devoured you will be devoured. Every one of your enemies will go into captivity. Those who plundered you will be plundered, and those who preyed on you will become prey themselves.

verses.kjv: For I will restore health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the LORD; because they called thee an Outcast, saying, This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
verses.web: For I will restore health to you, and I will heal you of your wounds,” says LORD; “because they have called you an outcast, saying, ‘It is Zion, whom no man seeks after.’ ”
verses.ct: I will restore your health and heal your wounds," declares the LORD, "because they called you an outcast, saying, 'That's Zion — nobody cares about her.'"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will bring again the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have mercy on his dwellingplaces; and the city shall be builded upon her own heap, and the palace shall remain after the manner thereof.
verses.web: LORD says: “Behold, I will reverse the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have compassion on his dwelling places. The city will be built on its own hill, and the palace will be inhabited in its own place.
verses.ct: The LORD says: "I will bring Jacob's people back from captivity and have mercy on their homes. The city will be rebuilt on its own ruins, and the palace will stand again in its rightful place.

verses.kjv: And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving and the voice of them that make merry: and I will multiply them, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify them, and they shall not be small.
verses.web: Thanksgiving will proceed out of them with the voice of those who make merry. I will multiply them, and they will not be few; I will also glorify them, and they will not be small.
verses.ct: Songs of thanksgiving and joyful laughter will pour out from them. I will increase their numbers so they are no longer few. I will honor them so they are no longer looked down on.

verses.kjv: Their children also shall be as aforetime, and their congregation shall be established before me, and I will punish all that oppress them.
verses.web: Their children also will be as before, and their congregation will be established before me. I will punish all who oppress them.
verses.ct: Their children will thrive as they did in the old days, and their community will be established in my presence. I will punish everyone who oppresses them.

verses.kjv: And their nobles shall be of themselves, and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is this that engaged his heart to approach unto me? saith the LORD.
verses.web: Their prince will be one of them, and their ruler will proceed from among them. I will cause him to draw near, and he will approach me; for who is he who has had boldness to approach me?” says LORD.
verses.ct: Their leader will be one of their own — their ruler will come from among them. I will invite him close, and he will approach me. For who would dare to come near me on his own?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And ye shall be my people, and I will be your God.
verses.web: “You shall be my people, and I will be your God.
verses.ct: "You will be my people, and I will be your God."

verses.kjv: Behold, the whirlwind of the LORD goeth forth with fury, a continuing whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
verses.web: Behold, LORD’s storm, his wrath, has gone out, a sweeping storm: it will burst on the head of the wicked.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD's fury has gone out like a whirlwind, a driving storm that will crash down on the heads of the wicked.

verses.kjv: The fierce anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have done it, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it.
verses.web: The fierce anger of LORD will not return until he has accomplished, and until he has performed the intentions of his heart. In the latter days you will understand it.”
verses.ct: The fierce anger of the LORD will not turn back until he has finished his work and carried out every intention of his heart. In the days to come, you will understand all of this.
